item.description: Industrial group Bidvest (BVT) today reported a 26.2% increase in headline earnings per share to 686.6 cents for the year ended June 30 from 554 cents a year ago.

item.title: Organic Food 'lie'
item.description: ORGANIC FOOD 'LIE' SHOPPERS who buy organic food may be victims of fraudsters, trading standards officials warned. Farmers, retailers and food inspectors have reported food falsely passed off as organic.

item.title: Organic food fraud leaves a nasty taste in the mouth
item.description: BRITAIN'S organic food sector is facing its first major crisis after an investigation uncovered considerable levels of fraud within the industry.

item.title: Foodstyle: Lydia Slater - Truly scrumptious
item.description: How do you fortify yourself for an exhausting day's retail therapy? Captain Scott's expedition biscuits got him to the South Pole, so they should be able to cope with the rigours of the high street - even on a Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Foodstyle: Take 3 ingredients
item.description: Chef Conrad Gallagher suggests this tasty side dish of mirin-roasted baby carrots with thyme. 20 baby carrots, stalks on, scrubbed 100ml mirin (Japanese rice wine) 1 small bunch of thyme, leaves picked Place the carrots on tinfoil.

item.title: How to poach an egg
item.description: Poached eggs taste like the pure essence of eggs. The simplicity of a poached egg is what makes it so good. A flawless poached egg is compact, with glistening whites clinging to a barely set yolk.

item.title: Culinary Postcard: Hawaii
item.description: Moloka'i has been all about my grandmother since the day I was born there. Grandma is solace. Grandma is refuge. Grandma is comfort food from the moment of my arrival at her Kaunakakai house.

item.title: Culinary Postcard: Seattle
item.description: For anyone who loves to eat, Seattle is one of the most dynamic and satisfying places to be in the country. The market basket from which we cook here overflows.

item.title: Dim Sum
item.description: When does one eat dim sum? Whenever your heart delights. Our dim sum recipes are simple and include step-by-step instructions. And at home, unlike in a restaurant, you can control what goes into the food and how it's cooked.

item.title: Fudge for yourself
item.description: Roly's traditional recipes are are sweet, sticky and totally irresistable, finds Harriot Lane Fox Totnes is a foodie town.

item.title: Seasonings in the sun
item.description: BanderillasWatermelon and feta saladEggs, tomatoes and pangratatoTuna and orangesBanana drop scones Part of being on holiday is eating outside, which generally means a picnic.

item.title: A toast to blendship
item.description: The British feel curiously at home in the Portuguese city of Oporto, where they have produced its namesake for more than 300 years, says Jonathan Ray As a British visitor to Oporto, it is hard to feel homesick.

item.title: In Season: Finding the farmers
item.description: The Dallas Farmers Market has three main types of vendors, all clearly labeled. Knowing the differences will help you track down local, seasonal produce. FARMERS: The seasonal farmers are located in Shed No. 4, the one farthest south.

item.title: Coffee beans don't get much fresher than the ones roasted on-site at White Rock Coffee
item.description: Once, he was a furniture retailer in Oregon, and she was a computer consultant in Dallas. But work is no longer the same old grind for Bob and Nancy Baker.

item.title: Foraging: New from Briannas
item.description: Briannas salad dressings are so good, you can even find them on the shelves of La Grande Epicerie, Paris' version of Central Market. The company is rolling out two new flavors: The New American Dressing and Saucy Ginger Mandarin.

item.title: A sweet find at Tart
item.description: Evans Caglage / DMN Whatcha in the mood for? A Snickers cupcake (front), Kit Kat cupcake (back left) and M&Ms cupcake (back right). Starting today, customers at Tart pastry boutique can get custom cupcakes at the bakery's new cupcake bar.
